Based on what you mentioned about "Dances with Wolves," I would recommend the movie "Paradise Lost" (1667), as both movies are set in historical times and feature similar themes, such as revenge and morality.

"Paradise Lost" tells the story of the biblical hero Moses, who is tasked with leading his people out of slavery in Egypt. However, when he reaches Mount Sinai to receive divine instructions for leading his people out of slavery in Egypt, he is met by the Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses II, who demands that Moses prove his worth as a leader by performing an act of bravery or courage.

However, when he is asked to perform an act of bravery or courage, he is unable to do so and instead performs an act of cowardice or fearfulness.

This results in Ramses II refusing to believe in Moses' ability as a leader, resulting in him ordering the destruction of all the cities, towns and villages throughout the land of Egypt, resulting in the deaths of millions of people.

The movie "Paradise Lost" is not only known for its historical accuracy, but it also features an impressive cast of actors, such as:
